abstract: Of all the wine regions in France, the Loire Valley may be at the top of the list for wine tourism. For starters, there is plenty to do for those members of a group who don't get excited by the prospect of standing around in chilly cellars, slurping and spitting wine and discussing the nuances of terroir with a local vigneron. And if you are into wine, it's got plenty to offer, including some reds that have recently come into their own.
